snippet: Get what you need before you know you need it.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Cass R Sunstein notes rise of predictive shopping, in which companies anticipate people's purchases based on compiled data and encourage enrollment in programs in which goods or services are delivered and billed automatically; describes survey she produced showing that while majority of Americans remain skeptical of increased automation in shopping, significant percentage welcome it; submits that predictive shopping has potential to be either liberating or invasive, and that it is likely to grow regardless.
lead_paragraph: Get what you need before you know you need it.
